sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Moscow orders all members of the controversial Wagner paramilitary group to pledge allegiance to Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: One of Italy's most flamboyant political figures and former Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi dies aged 86.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Russian Defense Minister Sergei Shuigu has ordered all volunteers and members of the Wagner Group to sign a contract with the ministry in an attempt to take direct control of the

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: paramilitary group.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The privately run Wagner Group has played a major role in the war in Ukraine, but also has a significant presence in other countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: On Monday, Russia published images of Chechen Special Forces Ahmad signing the agreement, angering Wagner leader Yevgeny Prigozhin, who's pledged to boycott the contracts. Чивака Вагнер согласует свое действие с генералами справа, слева, с командирами подразделений, имеет глубочайший опыт и является высокоэффективной структурой.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: К сожалению, такой эффективности большинство воинских частей не обладает.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: И именно из-за того, что Шойгу не может нормально управлять воинскими формированиями. It comes as Russian troops are reported to be suffering from low morale and shortages of ammunition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_13
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, arguments have broken out between military bosses and Wagner, which has fielded tens of thousands of mercenaries in the battle for Bakhmut.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: 10,000 soldiers from 25 countries have begun NATO air defence manoeuvres in Wunstorf, central Germany.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Far from a routine drill, it boasts 250 planes and is the largest ever exercise involving troops from the US-led alliance.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_14
sentences.sentence: This against the backdrop of rising tensions über die Invasion von der Ukraine. dass wir in der Lage sind, sehr schnell zu reagieren. Wir haben es jetzt geschafft, innerhalb weniger Tagen 250 Flugzeuge einsatzbereit zu haben, dass wir eben in der Lage wären, das Bündnis zu verteidigen im Falle eines Angriffs.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Die Wunsdorf-Aerobase wird als Kontrollzentrum verantwortlich sein, mit einer Begegnung von über 2.000 Flugzeugen über 10 Tage, um die rote Linie des NATOs nach Ostfront zu bemerken. some 2,000 flights over 10 days to mark the red lines of NATO's Eastern Front.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Italy's controversial billionaire media mogul, businessman and former Prime Minister Silvio

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Berlusconi has died at the age of 86. He was readmitted to hospital last week for a check-up after treatment for a lung infection linked to a form of leukemia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Plagued by scandal, the larger than life character who once compared himself to Jesus was Italy's longest serving premier and dominated public life for decades.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: Silvio Berlusconi era soprattutto un combattente, era un uomo che non aveva mai avuto paura a difendere le sue convinzioni e sono stati esattamente quel coraggio, quella determinazione a farne uno degli uomini più influenti della storia d'Italia, a consentirgli di imprimere delle vere e proprie svolte nel mondo della politica, della comunicazione, nel mondo dell'impresa. hospital where he died, people have been paying tribute to the flamboyant political figure.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: Despite remaining president of his Forza Italia party, a junior partner in Maloney's coalition, he had largely retired from public view in recent months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: For many Italians, including those outside the political arena, the news of the death of Silvio Berlusconi marks the end of an era.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Nobody, in fact, in recent Italian history has managed to leave such a significant mark on both Italian and international politics and on Italian culture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Berlusconi has been in the spotlight for many years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And let's remind ourselves of the fact that the full time prime minister also created Italy's largest media company despite all the scandals both financial and sexual. But Lascone remained in power for many years. And in fact a political analyst highlight the fact that one of the most remarkable things about Berlusconi was that he was able to inspire trust in many people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: was that he was able to inspire trust in many people.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: According to the latest reports, Berlusconi's state funerals will be held this Wednesday in Milan, the city where he was born, differently from what early reports had suggested, saying that state funerals would be held in Rome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Giorgia Orlandi for Euronews in Rome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: A new clampdown on tourism rental businesses has triggered a heated debate in Italy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The proposed law aims to address the lack of affordable housing and help repopulate major cities. The nationwide bill, which attempts to regulate the market by targeting all types of short-term lets, from Airbnb to villas, is also creating a deep divide among business categories. Il fatto che il governo abbia avuto i primi tempi per regolare il mercato per avviare tutti i tipi di short-term let, da Airbnb a villa, crea anche una profonda dividenza tra le categorie di business.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: I proprietari di hotel, in effetti, richiedono più giustizia e le stesse regole per applicare a tutte le aziende.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Un richiesto di 2 giorni di minimo di resta e un nuovo tipo di identificazione per le liste di proprietà sono alcune delle principali misure include nel decreto.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Oggi a Roma ci sono più di 25.000 alloggi. È in Rome there are more than 25,000 lodges.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's as if there were 10,000 hotels.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: If I want to open a hotel, I have to ask for 1,000 permits.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But someone can open 10,000 hotels without saying anything to anyone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: So more power to the syndicates, more controls and more sanctions, effective sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: But property managers are determinedere il loro business.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Andrea, che guarda 15 appartamenti a centro Roma, pensa che i suoi hotel e le sue appartamenti non sono comparabili.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Sicuramente il viaggiatore che sceglie l'appartamento è diverso dal viaggiatore che sceglie l'albergo.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Non sempre viene fatta una scelta solo economica o solo di cosa, ma spesso viene scelta l'appartamento perché può avere delle caratteristiche specifiche che possono essere apprezzate o anche da un viaggiatore che ha delle necessità diverse. Vedi noi abbiamo degli appartamenti vicino agli ospedali e quegli appartamenti sono scelti da persone che devono affrontare una spesa che magari non era prevista e quindi poter mangiare a casa può essere utile. Tutti, però, sembrano agire su un aspetto, che i business operando illegali dovrebbero essere finiti.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Siamo favorevoli alle sanzioni per chi non si adegua, siamo favorevoli a un livello di controllo gestito direttamente dal Ministro del Turismo e non da 20 normative regionali.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Con il turismo che accade per una grande parte dell'economia italiana, il bilancio è stato detto avere un grande impatto su uno dei maggiori mercati del mondo per le piccole e le piccole, With tourism accounting for a large chunk of the Italian economy, the bill is set to have a large impact on one of the largest markets in the world for short-term lets, although it's still a long way before the proposed bill becomes law.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Giorgia Orlandi for Euronews in Rome.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The scene of a tragic bus accident in Australia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: The incident took place on Sunday night in the popular Hunter Valley wine region some 180 kilometres north of Sydney. Ten wedding guests died and the 25 other passengers were injured when the bus they were travelling in overturned at the roundabout in dense fog. While the cause of the accident is yet to be determined, the driver of the bus has been charged with 10 counts of dangerous driving and is due to appear in court on Tuesday. One of the two people airlifted to Sydney following the crash remains in a critical condition.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Swiss banking giant UBS has completed the emergency takeover of its troubled rival Credit Suisse in the biggest banking deal since the 2008 global financial crisis. The deal, announced in March, was orchestrated by regulators in a bid to stave off further market turmoil in the global banking system. The group will now oversee more than 4.6 trillion euros of assets. The merger also brings to an end credit Swiss's 167-year history, marred in recent years by scandals and losses a letter

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: belonging to the assassin of French scientist and revolutionary John Paul Marat in 1793 has been sold at auction in Versailles for 215 thousand euros the document which was found on the killer Charlotte Corday, is believed to have been written one day before the murder.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: In it, she denounces Marat as the vialist of villains.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: 24-year-old Corday was arrested and executed by guillotine just days later in Paris.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_15
sentences.sentence: The document will be housed in the Normandy Department of Heritage and culture.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: This time next year, these secondary school goers won't just use their pens for exams, but also for voting.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: In the 2024 European elections, Belgium and Germany join Austria, Greece and Malta in allowing 16-year-olds to vote.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Pupils here are informed and motivated. Les jeunes sont informés et motivés. So the matters that we find important, we can actually have a voice and vote for parties or people that we think would carry these values.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: For example, in our class, climate change is quite important, or women's rights, and so people can actually use their voice to further these ideas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Lowering the voting age means that 270,000 young people in Belgium will be able to cast their ballot.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The goal of many youth organisations here for years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: A change they want to see all over the continent.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Young people should be heard and not just seen, they argue.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's true that some young people think that their voices and their votes don't matter.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: And that's why we need a bigger political change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Voting at 16 is a part of that change.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's one step to getting there.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: But we recognise we need some more radical changes if we need young people to feel truly engaged in our democracies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: That means having more young people in political parties, having more young people in positions of political power, and having young people's opinions taken seriously in our politics.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: But the big question now, will young people get registered for these elections and take time out to go to vote?

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Even in countries like Belgium, where voting is mandatory.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Previous EU elections show voter turnout among youth is dismally low.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The goal now is to change this tendency.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Of course, for us, the institution, the parliament, but maybe this should be even bigger than just the parliament, this is a priority for many reasons, and maybe the first reason is that these are probably the elections that are more clearly shaping the future for these new generations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_12
sentences.sentence: Because at the end of the day, what will happen at the European level will probably have a bigger and a longer impact than national decisions, let's say, year by year or in the short term.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Back in 2019, only 42% of first-time voters actually voted.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And only time will tell if they're motivated next year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: All eyes on politicians to see how they flirt with this generation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: Maeve McMahon, Euronews, Brussels.
